title: Congress slams government for ‚Äòdismantling‚Äô MGNREGA after passage of VB-G Ram G Bill
content: Party leader K.C. Venugopal says the Modi government had effectively dismantled the MGNREGA by converting it from a right to a favour

title: Stand-off at Thrissur MCH as Walayar lynching victim‚Äôs family refuses to receive body
content: Family of migrant worker Ram Narayan demands ‚Çπ25 lakh compensation, mob-lynching charges, and state support to transport body home

title: Odisha Governor lays stress on cultural integration at ABVP State convention
content: Haribabu  urges the youth wing to launch a tirade against rampant drug menace in the country and create awareness among fellow students on the impact of substance abuse

title: Snowfall ends long dry spell, heralds the revival of festive year-end tourism in Kashmir Valley
content: Tourists were mesmerised by a thick, white blanket of snow, setting the stage for Christmas and New Year celebrations, and winter sports in the Valley

title: TTD donates breath analysers to Tirupati police
content: They help in preventing road accidents and ensuring adherence to traffic rules, says Executive Officer Anil Kumar Singhal after handing over the gadgets to Superintendent of Police Subbarayudu

title: Local body polls 2025: members take oath in local bodies across Kerala, spotlight on Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: In the 2025 local body elections, the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation had witnessed a seismic shift with the LDF losing its grip on the 101-ward civic body after more than four decades.

title: Justice delayed: consumers caught in a web of systemic inconsistencies
content: Long travel, repeated adjournments and mounting backlogs are turning consumer courts into a test of endurance for litigants.

title: Post deadline extension, Waqf Board deals with  new challenges
content: Focus will be on registering the 3,000 institutions enumerated under kitabul waqf, and 13,000 registered under second waqf survey

title: Post-SIR, size of electorate in Chennai and nearby districts remains larger than votes polled in 2021 and 2026 polls
content: Only in four constituencies ‚Äî Villivakkam, R.K. Nagar, Perambur, and Anna Nagar ‚Äî did the number of votes polled in 2021 exceed the revised strength of the electorate

title: SIT seeks VSSC expertise to quantify original gold content in Sabarimala temple‚Äôs gilded panels
content: VSSC‚Äôs metallurgical analysis report may provide SIT with a scientific baseline for comparing metallurgical nature of the original gilded panels with those returned to the temple after restoration by prime accused Unnikrishnan Potti in 2019

title: Thrissur Corporation councillors, district panchayat members take oath
content: All 56 councillors sworn in as first council meeting held;  oath ceremony of district panchayat members  held at  District Planning Bhavan

title: CREDAI thanks government for amending building rules in Andhra Pradesh
content: The changes ensure alignment with prominent national jurisdictions and provide clear regulatory certainty for both developers and approving authorities, say CREDAI office-bearers

title: Karnataka notifies auction of 569 liquor vends in January to raise resources
content: State hopes to raise between ‚Çπ600 crore and ‚Çπ1,000 crore through the e-auction announced by Chief Minister in the 2025-2026 Budget

title: Vijayanagara legacy offers lessons for inclusive growth: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The Union Finance Minister visits UNESCO World Heritage site at Hampi in Vijayanagara along with a team of 120 officers from her Ministry

title: CFP first-round takeaways: Miami's run game, special teams woes and blowouts
content: After two nail-biters and two one-sided scores, we've got our quarterfinals. Here's what we've learned from this weekend's games.

title: Eagles go for 2, igniting brawl; Sirianni backs play
content: An on-field fight resulted in three players being ejected in Saturday's Eagles-Commanders game after Philadelphia, up by 17 late in the fourth quarter, decided to go for a 2-point conversion.

title: Williams' OT magic caps Bears' latest comeback
content: Caleb Williams capped his NFL-leading sixth comeback win from a fourth-quarter deficit with a thrilling 46-yard touchdown pass to DJ Moore to stun the Packers 22-16 in overtime.

title: Lanning: Ducks fell short of 'standard' in CFP win
content: Dan Lanning expressed disappointment with how Oregon performed in the second half versus James Madison, despite advancing in the CFP for the first time since 2014.

title: Sources: HR record-setter Murakami picks ChiSox
content: Japanese slugger Munetaka Murakami, who hit 56 home runs in Nippon Professional Baseball in 2022, has agreed to a two-year, $34 million contract with the White Sox, sources told ESPN.

title: Short-handed Texas Tech jolts unbeaten Duke late
content: No. 19 Texas Tech, beset by injuries, rallied from 17 down to stun third-ranked Duke 82-81 at Madison Square Garden.

title: Pack lose Love to concussion, unravel in OT loss
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love suffered a concussion on a helmet-to-helmet hit, and Green Bay blew a 10-point lead late in the fourth quarter of Saturday's crucial overtime loss to the Bears.

title: For Ole Miss, a gratifying 1st CFP win without Kiffin
content: Tony Golding and Ole Miss passed their first test since Lane Kiffin's abrupt departure, blowing out Tulane on Saturday to earn the Rebels their first CFP victory.

title: üèà NFL playoff-clinching scenarios for Week 16
content: In Week 16, nine NFL teams have the chance to clinch a playoff berth. The Broncos can also lock up the AFC's No. 1 seed.

title: Week 16 inactives: Status of Tee Higgins, Marvin Harrison Jr. and others
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Volleyball title game primer: Keys to an SEC exclusive
content: The all-SEC showdown features big hitters who have beome quite comfortable on the biggest stage. So what are the X factors?

title: Week 16 betting guide: Backing Maye to throw Patriots to a W, Achane to run wild
content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 16 and share their tips and bets.

title: The Jake Paul show is far from over, but where does it go from here?
content: Even in defeat, Jake Paul's boxing career is far from over, but his next move could be one of the most important yet.

title: Liverpool's win marred by Isak injury as pressure mounts on Spurs' Frank
content: Liverpool's third straight win in all competitions came at a cost while furthering Spurs fans' frustration with Thomas Frank.

title: Tag team title match leaves something to be desired
content: A disappointing end to the men's tag team championship, was emblematic of a building-block 'SmackDown.'

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man City, Liverpool eye Bayern star Olise
content: Bayern Munich's Michael Olise is wanted by a host of other top European clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Watch: What RSS chief said on live-in relationships & how many children to have
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, speaking in Kolkata, voiced concerns about live-in relationships, deeming them an unwillingness to accept responsibility. He suggested renunciation for those avoiding marriage. Bhagwat also shared insights from experts, recommending early marriage (19-25) and three children for health and ego management, while acknowledging his personal lack of experience in these matters.

title: 'Threat to religious freedom': Sikh leader condemns disruption of nagar kirtan in NZ
content: Shiromani Akali Dal president Sukhbir Singh Badal condemned the disruption of a peaceful Sikh Nagar Kirtan in New Zealand, calling it a threat to religious freedom and universal brotherhood. He praised the Sikh community for maintaining restraint despite provocation and urged external affairs minister S Jaishankar to raise the issue with the New Zealand government, as police intervened to ensure the procession could continue safely.

title: 'Pak under Asim law': Jailed ex-PM Imran Khan flays army chief; calls for nation to rise
content: Imprisoned former Pakistan PM Imran Khan has called for nationwide protests and vowed to challenge the recent Toshakhana-II verdict, which he claims was delivered hastily and without evidence. Khan alleges he and his wife are subjected to harsh solitary confinement and criticizes army chief Asim Munir, stating Pakistan is governed by 'Asim Law'.

title: IND vs PAK Final: Naqvi presents trophy to U19 Asia Cup champs - Watch
content: Pakistan's U19 team secured a dominant 191-run victory over India in the Asia Cup final, preventing a repeat of the senior tournament's trophy presentation drama.  A stellar 172 by Sameer Minhas powered Pakistan to 347, a target India couldn't approach, falling for 156. Indian players collected medals separately, avoiding the ACC chairman.

title: China's Manhattan Project: Scientists build chip-making machine; proves ASML CEO wrong
content: China has reportedly built a working prototype of an advanced chip-making machine, defying Western predictions.  Former ASML engineers are said to be behind the project, which aims for semiconductor independence. This development, a six-year government initiative, could significantly alter global chip supply chains, challenging ASML's monopoly on crucial EUV technology.

title: Mountains older than memory: How new 'definition' of Aravalli risks eroding 'Viksit Bharat'
content: India's ancient Aravalli Range faces a new definition crisis after a Supreme Court ruling.  The court accepted a 100-meter elevation threshold for identifying the hills, sparking concerns among environmentalists. Critics argue this narrow view ignores the range's vital ecological functions, potentially opening it to unchecked mining and real estate development, threatening water security and climate stability.

title: Bezos' ex-wife's charity: Biggest annual donation of $7.1B in 2025; Amazon stake halved
content: MacKenzie Scott donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits. This marks her largest annual giveaway, with significant contributions to diversity and equity initiatives like Howard University and college access programs. Scott has also reduced her Amazon stake by $12.6 billion.

title: The Watchlist: Why It's a Wonderful Life is the perfect movie to restore your faith in humanity
content: A late-night viewing of 'It's a Wonderful Life' offered unexpected solace and a profound reminder of life's value. The film beautifully portrays George Bailey's selfless nature and his struggle with perceived failure. Through a guardian angel's intervention, George realizes the immense impact of his quiet sacrifices, highlighting the significance of every life and the power of gratitude.

title: U19 Asia Cup: India fold for 156; Pakistan win final by 191 runs to lift trophy
content: India suffered a crushing 191-run defeat to Pakistan in the U-19 Asia Cup final. Chasing a daunting 348, India collapsed to 156 all out. Pakistan bowlers didn't give away and bowled tight lines from the beginning. Fast bowler Ali Raza took 4 wickets, including Ayush Mhatre, and Vaibhav Sooryavanshi. While Mohammad Sayyam, Abdul Subhan, Huzaifa Ahsan took 2 wickets each.‚Äã‚Äã

title: BJP won 2-0 in 2025 elections, can opposition bounce back in 2026?
content: Following BJP's 2025 victories in Delhi and Bihar, 2026 presents a crucial comeback opportunity for the opposition. Key contests in West Bengal, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Assam, and Puducherry will test incumbent governments and emerging political forces, with updated electoral rolls adding another layer of intrigue to these significant state elections.

title: US department of state gives update on the delay in Visa appointments
content: American embassies worldwide, including in India, are facing up to a year-long wait for visa appointments due to enhanced screening. Tech giants like Google and Apple are now cautioning H-1B visa holders against international travel, fearing extended stays abroad. New social media checks are causing significant backlogs, impacting professionals and their families.

title: IND vs PAK final: Heated! Mhatre confronts Pakistan bowler ‚Äì Watch
content: India's U19 Asia Cup final against Pakistan in Dubai included a heated exchange after captain Ayush Mhatre's early dismissal. Pakistan posted a formidable 347, thanks to Sameer Minhas's 172, putting India under immense pressure. Mhatre's quick exit and subsequent on-field confrontation added to the intense rivalry, as India struggled in their chase.

title: ‚ÄòSecond killing of Gandhi‚Äô: Chidambaram hits out at Centre over VB-G RAM G bill, calls it fraud
content: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram strongly criticized the Centre's move to replace MGNREGA, calling it the "second killing of Mahatma Gandhi." He stated the party will oppose the new VB-G RAM G bill until the original employment guarantee framework is restored, vowing to expose the alleged fraud.

title: Exports to US rebound in Nov amid supply-chain shifts & holiday restocking: GTRI
content: India's exports to the US rebounded in November after two months of continuous decline. growing by 22.61% to reach $6.98 billion. This was largely driven by upply-chain adjustments and pre-holiday season inventory restocking, according to the Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI). The trade data shows imports from the US also grew significantly, jumping 38.29 per cent to $5.25 billion during the month.

title: 'Might change name': Cong taunts BJP over rlys fare hike; slams increasing travel prices
content: Congress MP Ranjeet Ranjan criticized the Union government's recent railway fare hike, stating it will burden the middle and lower middle class before the Union budget. She slammed the increase of Rs 10 per 500 km, impacting long-distance travel costs significantly.

title: 3-state crime spree: How gang used Google maps to plan burglaries
content: Police in Jamshedpur have arrested a gang of thieves who utilized Google Maps to scout and target homes for burglaries across Jharkhand, West Bengal, and Bihar. The trio, apprehended after a break-in in Golmuri, were found with stolen gold, a firearm, and tools used for their crimes. They have been placed in judicial custody.

title: 'Chilling message': Cong slams Bihar guv for defending Nitish; hijab row intensifies
content: Congress criticizes Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for allegedly violating a young woman's bodily autonomy during an appointment letter distribution event. A video showed Kumar questioning a doctor's naqab, which the Congress leader described as an attempt to normalize unwanted touch from influential men. The doctor has since not reported for duty.

title: VB-G Ram G: President gives assent to Bill; oppn slams new jobs scheme
content: President Droupadi Murmu has approved the Viksit Bharat‚ÄîGuarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill, 2025, replacing the MGNREGA. The new law guarantees 125 days of wage employment annually to rural households volunteering for unskilled manual work, aligning with the Viksit Bharat 2047 vision. Opposition parties have criticized the move, citing concerns over undermining Mahatma Gandhi's legacy.

title: T20 WC squad: Gambhir asked about Gill omission at airport - Watch
content: India revealed its T20 World Cup 2026 squad. Shubman Gill's exclusion surprised many. Ishan Kishan's strong domestic form earned him a spot. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar cited Gill's lack of runs. Captain Suryakumar Yadav emphasized the need for an aggressive opening wicketkeeper. The selection signals a focus on attacking players for the upcoming tournament.

title: B'desh unrest: India rebuts Dhaka media's 'propaganda'; flags atrocities against minorities
content: India has dismissed Bangladeshi media reports as "misleading propaganda" regarding a protest outside its High Commission in New Delhi. The demonstration, involving a small group, protested the killing of a minority member in Mymensingh. India is monitoring the situation in Bangladesh and has conveyed strong concerns over minority atrocities, urging justice for the victim.

title: Messi got Rs 89cr for India tour, govt Rs 11cr as tax: Organiser blames ‚Äòinfluential' people
content: Event organizer Satadru Dutta was arrested following chaos during the Messi tour in Kolkata. Police seized Rs 22 crore from his accounts, suspecting black money use. Dutta claimed Rs 100 crore was spent, but investigators doubt his financial figures. He also blamed others for the event's disorder, citing pressures for increased access.

title: 'Huge mistake': Bhagwat on viewing RSS through BJP lens; clarifies objective of outfit
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that understanding the Sangh through the BJP lens is a ‚Äúhuge mistake‚Äù and stressed that the organisation has no political agenda. Addressing programmes in Kolkata, he said the RSS should not be compared to political or service organisations and works for the betterment and protection of Hindu society, calling for opinions about the Sangh to be based on facts rather than narratives.

title: 'I don‚Äôt wanna be alive': Tom Brady‚Äôs post sparks mental health concerns
content: Following news of Gisele B√ºndchen's marriage to Joaquim Valente, Tom Brady shared a song on Instagram with lyrics about mental health struggles and suicidal thoughts, sparking fan concern. The couple, who welcomed a baby earlier this year, reportedly began dating in June 2023. Brady's song choice, Logic's '1-800-273-8255', has raised questions about his state of mind.

title: Stock market activity possibly muted for the week; what experts said
content: Stock markets have to brace for a cautious start to the week, influenced by foreign investor activity and global economic cues. A shortened trading week due to Christmas may also result in subdued volumes. Experts anticipate a range-bound market with a positive bias, driven by renewed FII interest and a slight INR recovery, as investors eye upcoming Q3 earnings.

title: How the Indian education system is responding to high AQI and cold waves
content: North Indian schools are adapting to winter challenges, with hazardous air quality and cold waves forcing changes. Delhi-NCR schools are shifting to online and hybrid models under GRAP IV. Uttar Pradesh districts are closing schools due to fog and cold, while Bihar is revising timings to safeguard students. These measures prioritize health amidst extreme weather.

title: Not Bishop or Simon Doull: Fans give pitch report during NZ vs WI Test - Watch
content: Fans offered their opinions on the Mount Maunganui pitch, a role typically for experts, as New Zealand built a commanding lead against the West Indies. Centuries from Latham and Conway bolstered New Zealand's position, setting a challenging target of 462 after bowling out the West Indies for 420 and declaring their second innings at 306/2.

title: Train travel gets costlier: Here is how much your ticket will cost now
content: Indian Railways will implement a revised fare structure from December 26 to address rising operational and manpower costs. Passengers traveling beyond 215 km in Ordinary Class will see a 1 paise per kilometer increase, while Mail and Express non-AC and AC coaches will face a 2 paise per kilometer hike. Suburban and monthly season tickets remain unchanged.

title: San Francisco blackout: Power outage leaves nearly a third of city in darkness
content: San Francisco faced a massive power outage on Saturday, impacting over 124,000 customers and disrupting daily life just before Christmas. A fire at a PG&E substation was identified as the cause, leading to widespread closures of businesses and transit. Power restoration efforts were underway overnight.

title: U19 Asia Cup: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi fails again; departs cheaply in final
content: Teenage prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi was dismissed for 26 in the U19 Asia Cup final against Pakistan. Pakistan opener Sameer Minhas starred with a brilliant 172, propelling Pakistan to a massive 347/8. India, chasing the steep target, found themselves in deep trouble after early wickets. Sooryavanshi also failed to score big in the semi-final against Sri Lanka.

title: Pay to meet Tihar inmates: Operators' role under lens over illegal mulakat charges
content: A racket charging relatives for legally free inmate meetings at Tihar Jail has been exposed. An inmate's tip-off led to an investigation where undercover officials were asked for money. As a precaution, 20-25 data entry operators were transferred while the probe into touts and system misuse continues. Biometric authentication is being introduced to enhance security.

title: B'desh unrest: India suspends visa services in Chittagong; cites security concerns, protests
content: Indian visa operations in Chittagong have been indefinitely suspended following protests near the Indian High Commission. This closure, along with earlier disruptions in Dhaka and other cities, comes amid rising tensions in Bangladesh. Ministry of external affairs has expressed strong concern and also refuted certain media reports regarding recent protests.

title: 'Really bad example': Bangladeshi scribe on violence after Hadi's death; flags lapses
content: A senior Bangladeshi journalist has criticized the post-death violence following the killing of activist Osman Hadi, citing serious law and order lapses. He stated that while public grief was understandable, fringe elements exploited the situation, leading to attacks on media and cultural institutions, sending a troubling signal ahead of the national election slated for February.

title: Chillai-Kalan begins: Kashmir sees snow and rain in its higher reaches - watch
content: Kashmir experienced fresh snowfall in higher reaches and rain in plains as Chillai-Kalan, the harshest winter period, commenced after a dry spell. Authorities have finalized preparations for potential heavy snowfall, anticipating improved air quality and a boost to winter tourism despite possible hardships.

title: T20 World Cup: 'Jaiswal deserved spot over Ishan'- Ex-India batter calls out India‚Äôs picks
content: Former opener Wasim Jaffer has voiced strong opinions on India's 2026 T20 World Cup squad, advocating for Yashasvi Jaiswal and Jitesh Sharma over Ishan Kishan and Washington Sundar. Jaffer's critique follows Shubman Gill's surprising omission. Axar Patel is now vice-captain. The tournament, co-hosted by Sri Lanka and India, sees the defending champions in Group A.

title: No ‚Äòsanskar‚Äô: UP police arrest four women after sons ‚Äòharass‚Äô teen girl
content: In Budaun, police arrested four mothers under preventive laws after their sons, all under 13, allegedly harassed a Class 8 girl. The action aims to hold parents accountable for not instilling 'good values'. Fathers, working out of state, will face arrest upon return. Legal experts question the use of preventive detention against parents.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office day 17: Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna starrer crosses Rs 530 c
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is shattering box office records, entering its third week with impressive earnings. The film defied competition from 'Avatar Fire And Ash', even showing growth on its third Saturday. With a total collection of ‚Çπ530.26 crore, it has now surpassed the lifetime collection of 'Gadar 2', marking a significant achievement in Indian cinema.

title: Investor onboarding loses pace: Fresh equity registrations fall 11% in November
content: New investor additions to India's stock markets slowed in November, with 13.2 lakh new traders joining, an 11.6% dip from October. Global uncertainty impacted participation, though the overall investor base reached 12.3 crore. This moderation follows a period of rapid growth, indicating a cautious sentiment among potential investors amidst volatile global conditions.

title: God of War 1 & 2 Remake update, what to expect, release date, gameplay features, and other details
content: Fans hoping for a God of War Greek Saga Remaster for the 20th anniversary were disappointed, but rumors persist of a potential rebuild for modern consoles.  A remake could bring a visual overhaul with Unreal Engine 5, modernized combat, and possibly narrative tweaks to bridge Kratos' past and present journeys.  Details remain unconfirmed.

title: French culture boss accused of mass 'drinks spiking' to humiliate women
content: A former culture ministry HR manager, Christian Negre, allegedly drugged around 200 women with diuretics during job interviews, forcing them into humiliating situations. Hiyam Zarouri recounts being made to walk for hours in pain after her coffee was spiked. Negre admitted to imposing humiliating situations and was fired, but victims fear he still poses a threat.

title: Can I lore drop? How Gen Z language is changing mental therapy, one word at a time
content: Young patients are increasingly using social media-derived psychological terms in therapy, presenting a new challenge for clinicians. While this vocabulary aids expression, it also leads to self-diagnosis and over-pathologizing normal experiences. Therapists are adapting to bridge this linguistic gap, validating feelings while reframing them accurately.

title: Human-wildlife conflict: Bhupender Yadav chairs meetings to review measures, discuss project updates
content: The Union Environment Minister underscores the importance of science-based management, landscape-level planning, community participation and inter-State coordination in India's globally recognised tiger conservation model

title: Judges must uphold values with discipline, legal knowledge, says SC judge
content: Advises judges to remain calm and composed even in complex situations and stressed on the importance of the district judiciary

title: TDP appoints new district presidents, general secretaries for 25 Parliamentary constituencies
content: A significant number of them belong to the Backward Classes, Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes, and Minorities

title: Local leaders creating confusion over leadership issue: Kharge
content: Congress chief says he will look into a letter sent by leaders to resolve the issue; DKS meets Rajanna, dismisses talk of rift with CM

title: Two-day PESA Mahotsav in Visakhapatnam on December 23-24
content: The Panchayats (Extension to Scheduled Areas) Act Mahotsav is envisaged as a national platform to celebrate the cultural and traditional heritage of tribal communities from PESA areas

title: Kerala State Electricity Boards invites EoI for establishing public EV charging stations under PM E-DRIVE scheme
content: Power utility invites expressions of interest for operators under category C of the scheme for establishing charging stations on land parcels with ‚Äòunrestricted public access.‚Äô Category C covers charging infrastructure on locations such as city streets, shopping malls, market complexes and highways

title: Enthusiasm and fervour marks Jagan‚Äôs birthday celebrations in A.P., Europe
content: Grand celebrations held at the YSRCP central office in Tadepalli, while members of YSRCP Europe unit, along with supporters from the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium and Switzerland, celebrate the party president‚Äôs birthday in Eindhoven, Netherlands

title: Maharashtra MP says Belagavi DC illegally restrained him from entering district
content: Dhairyasheel S. Mane submits a complaint to the Lok Sabha Speaker even as Kannada organisations in the district condemn the move

title: Loans, lost documents, and loss of homes: Residents face crisis after Kogilu Layout demolition
content: Government agencies demolished over 150 houses in Fakeer Colony and parts of Waseem Layout in¬†Kogilu¬†Layout, Yelahanka, leaving around 500 people homeless

title: Centre rejects mining push charge behind Aravalli definition
content: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav told reporters in the Sundarban Tiger Reserve that the Supreme Court-approved definition will bring more than 90% of the Aravalli region under ‚Äúprotected area‚Äù

title: Tipra Motha to go solo in district council polls if Tiprasa Accord not implemented: Pradyot
content: Claiming that the Centre was willing to implement the accord, the TMP chief said certain leaders in the State appeared to be opposed to its implementation.

title: Jagan‚Äôs birthday cutout featuring KCR, KTR sparks political discussion
content: The cutout, installed near Tadepalli, close to Jagan‚Äôs residence, prominently displays the message ‚ÄòHappy Birthday Jagannanna‚Äô; cutout erected by a resident of Serilingampally in Telangana, say sources

title: Railways to prepare reservation charts 10 hours in advance
content: This is to inform passengers from remote locations about their reservation status and relieve them of anxiety, says South Central Railway official

title: Nirmala stresses on AI, regulatory predictability for Viksit Bharat
content: She was chairing a high-level Chintan Shivir of the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of Corporate Affairs at Hampi in Vijayanagara

title: Victory of team BJP; fought local body polls on development plank: Fadnavis
content: Devendra Fadnavis said that the BJP has once again emerged as the ‚Äúsingle-largest‚Äù party in an election

title: After long wait, TDB starts serving Kerala sadya at Sabarimala
content: Around 5,000 devotees participate in the free meal programme every afternoon, with a rotating menu of sadya and pulao on alternate days.

title: Couple detained as video of differently abled boy being beaten goes viral
content: The video of the incident is said to have been captured in a school run by the couple in Navanagar of Bagalkot

title: Baby trafficking networks thrive despite repeated crackdowns in Andhra Pradesh
content: Recent arrests and rescues highlight how interstate gangs continue to exploit loopholes in the State‚Äôs child protection system

title: Watch: Home Ministry increases reservation for ex-Agniveers in CAPFs to 50% | Explained
content: The Union Home Ministry has announced a major policy shift for ex-Agniveers, raising their reservation in Group C posts of the Central Armed Police Forces from 10% to 50%, starting with the Border Security Force.

title: Soil tests in Kuttanad paddy fields show aluminium levels 39 to 165 times above safe limits
content: Call for urgent government intervention.  Analysis shows concentrations between 77.51 and 334.10 ppm, primarily linked to increasing soil acidity that threatens crop health and the livelihoods of local farmers.

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on two day Delhi tour, likely to meet PM Modi and NDA leaders
content: An issue that may come up for discussion is the much-speculated entry into politics of Nishant, the only son of the state‚Äôs longest-serving Chief Minister

title: Watch: Indian Railways announces passenger fare revision from December 26
content: The Ministry of Railways has announced a rationalisation of passenger fares, effective from December 26, aiming to balance rising operational costs while keeping passenger impact minimal.

title: Delhi airport incident: Air India Express issues show-cause notice to pilot, to set up external inquiry panel
content: Soon after the incident, the Tata Group-owned airline suspended the pilot for assaulting a passenger, and a show-cause notice has been served to him seeking an explanation

title: Union Minister Kishan Reddy should bring funds to Telangana than writing letters: Congress MP Chamala Kiran
content: Stating that the BJP has not seriously thought about Telangana‚Äôs future, Chamala Kiran Kumar Reddy said it was Kishan Reddy‚Äôs responsibility as a Union Minister to bring more funds to the State

title: Maharashtra civic poll results: Recounting ordered in Kamptee after Congress opposes BJP's 116-vote win
content: Trends showed the Mahayuti, comprising the BJP, Ajit Pawar's NCP and Shinde's Shiv Sena, ahead comfortably

title: VB-G RAM G Bill gets President's assent
content: It seeks to replace the existing rural employment law, MGNREGA, and guarantees 125 days of wage employment per rural household per financial year

title: BJP slams Gehlot‚Äôs ‚ÄòSave Aravalli‚Äô campaign, assures mining will not expand under new definition
content: Calling Mr. Gehlot‚Äôs claim ‚Äúcompletely false and misleading‚Äù, Rajendra Rathore says approximately 25% of the Aravalli area falls under wildlife sanctuaries, national parks, reserved forests where mining is completely prohibited

title: Singer Lagnajita Chakraborty alleges harassment at event in Bengal, organiser held
content: Lagnajita Chakraborty claimed that the incident took place on Saturday (December 20) evening during a cultural programme at the school, located in Bhagabanpur, where she was performing

title: Deaf and mute woman breaks 16-year silence, exposes serial sexual abuse, blackmail in Mumbai
content: A probe has revealed that the accused had similarly drugged and assaulted speech and hearing impaired women and threatened them into silence by blackmailing them with obscene videos, according to a police official

title: BJP begins final round of intra-party consultations to finalise NDA‚Äôs mayoral candidate in Thiruvananthapuram
content: BJP State leadership reportedly faces the difficulty of choosing between veteran grassroots-level party councillors with a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) background and a ranking police officer, a political ‚Äúarriviste‚Äù according to some in the BJP, for the Mayor‚Äôs post¬†

title: Congress settled illegal Bangladeshi migrants in Assam: PM Modi
content: Addressing a gathering in Dibrugarh district, the Prime Minister also criticised the grand old party for denying land rights to Assam‚Äôs tea plantation workers

title: Around 8 passenger trains cancelled for three days due to elephant movements between Jharkhand, Odisha
content: Movement of a herd of elephants has been noticed near rail tracks between Chakradharpur (Jharkhand's Singhbhum)-Jharsuguda (Odisha) section of the division, especially Bandamuna during night

title: Congress MP expresses shock over names of two voters in Thirupparankundram printed in Hindi
content: The names of voters against serial numbers 551 and 552, both residents of Tamil Nadu, have been mentioned in Hindi

title: Watch: Kerala bids tearful farewell to Malayalam cinema icon Sreenivasan
content: Kerala witnessed an emotional farewell as legendary actor, screenwriter and director Sreenivasan, one of the most influential figures in Malayalam cinema, was laid to rest with full state honours.

title: Telangana Government orders immediate shifting of all offices from private buildings, sets December 31 deadline
content: Officials directed to search for office space, the government said, adding that no rental payment from February 1

title: 'No Constitutional Approval Needed': RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat Says "India A Hindu Nation"
content: Stressing that India is a "Hindu nation," Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) Chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said that no constitutional approval is needed as it is the "truth".

title: 2 More Arrested Over Hindu Man's Lynching In Bangladesh: Report
content: Two more persons were arrested on Sunday in connection with the lynching of a Hindu man in Bangladesh, according to a media report.

title: BJP Single-Largest Party, Alliance Sweeps Maharashtra Local Body Polls
content: The ruling Mahayuti alliance won a decisive victory in the Maharashtra local bodies and the BJP emerged as the single largest party.

title: Delhi AQI 'Severe' At 16 Places, Overall Reading In 'Poor' Category
content: The air quality in the national capital was recorded in the 'very poor' category on Sunday morning with an overall Air Quality Index (AQI) reading of 377, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

title: Steward Arrested For Stealing Silverware From French President's Residence
content: Three men will stand trial next year after a silver steward employed at the official residence of the French president was arrested this week for the theft of items of silverware and table service worth thousands of euros, the Paris prosecutor's offi

title: Border Clashes With Thailand Displace Over Half Million People In Cambodia
content: More than half a million people in Cambodia have been displaced by two weeks of deadly border clashes with neighbouring Thailand, Phnom Penh said Sunday, ahead of regional talks aimed at easing tensions.

title: 'Over 90% Of Aravalli Region Remain Protected': Centre Rejects Mining Push Charge
content: The Centre on Sunday rejected claims that the new definition of the Aravalli range will allow large-scale mining and cited a Supreme Court-ordered freeze on new mining leases in the region.

title: Trump To Expand Immigration Crackdown In 2026 With Billions In New Funding
content: US President Donald Trump is preparing for a more aggressive immigration crackdown in 2026 with billions in new funding, including by raiding more workplaces - even as backlash builds ahead of next year's midterm elections.

title: 'Santas' In Gas Masks Hit Delhi Streets To Protest Air Pollution
content: People shopping in Delhi's South Extension and Connaught Place were surprised to see several Santa Clauses walking through the markets wearing gas masks.

title: 110 Flights Cancelled At Delhi Airport Due To Low-Visibility Conditions
content: A total of 110 flights were cancelled and over 370 services delayed due to low-visibility conditions amid fog at the Delhi airport on Sunday.

title: 2 Killed As Dense Fog Causes Truck-Bike Collision In UP's Bareilly: Cops
content: Two youths were killed, and another sustained critical injuries after a speeding truck hit their motorcycle amid dense fog on the Bareilly-Pilibhit highway here, police said on Sunday.

title: "He Puts Everything On Opposition": PM Modi vs M Kharge On Infiltration
content: The Congress-BJP divide over the issue of illegal immigrants has escalated, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge going toe-to-toe today.

title: Explained: Why Aravalli Is In Spotlight And What Environmentalists Demand
content: Beyond the legal semantics, the concerns are deeply rooted in the Aravallis' indispensable ecological functions.

title: "Being Done For Votes": Mohan Bhagwat On Babri Masjid Reconstruction In Bengal
content: Alleging a "political conspiracy" is underway to restart the dispute of the Babri Masjid, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said.

title: As Hindus Face Attacks, Yunus Appears To Lose Control In Bangladesh
content: The Indian visa application centre in Bangladesh's Chittagong (Chattogram) has shut down indefinitely after the security situation worsened, with Islamist radicals creating chaos and targeting minorities.

title: Drunk Man Kills 4-Year-Old Son After Fight With Wife In UP's Bhadohi: Cops
content: An inebriated man allegedly killed his four-year-old son by repeatedly slamming him on the ground following a quarrel with his wife, police said on Sunday.

title: G RAM G Bill, Which Will Replace MNREGA, Gets President Murmu's Assent
content: President Droupadi Murmu has given assent to the Viksit Bharat-Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) (VB-G RAM G) Bill, 2025, an official said on Sunday.

title: Revanth Reddy's "Christmas" Credit To Sonia Gandhi Draws BJP Fire
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy's endorsement of party chief Sonia Gandhi as a leader who single-handedly ensured the southern state could celebrate Christmas, has come under fire from the BJP.

title: Bangladesh's Bengali Cultural Institutions Targeted, Pattern Points To Pak
content: Cultural organisations in Bangladesh are under attack from Islamic radicals. The interim government formed after the toppling of Sheikh Hasina's regime has failed to rein in mobs that continue to target cultural institutions and minorities.

title: 1-Year-Old Boy, Walking Behind Mother, Mauled To Death By Leopard In Gujarat
content: A five-year-old son of a farm labourer was mauled to death by a leopard in Gujarat's Amreli district on Sunday morning, an official from the forest department said.

title: Betting lines for each CFP quarterfinal, other bowl games
content: the quarterfinals will be played on Dec. 31 and Jan. 1, then the semifinals on Jan. 8 and 9 leading up to the title game in Miami Gardens, Florida . no. 1 Indiana among the teams that will lay it all on the line for a chance to be crowned national champion .

title: College Football Playoff 2025: Quarterfinal first look
content: the canes beat Texas A&M thanks to an interception in the end zone in the final seconds of the game, and they will play Ohio State in the Cotton Bowl . the cotton bowls will be played on Jan. 1 and will be held on Dec. 31 .

title: Arsenal are 'Christmas champions,' but that'll count for nothing if Gunners can't hold
content: arsenal beat Everton 2-1 in their premier league clash on saturday . the win was a slog rather than a win built on attacking football . a first-half penalty was enough to earn the three points .

title: Questions, takeaways from NFL Week 16: Resilient Bears pull out OT thriller; Eagles repeat as NFC East champs
content: Chicago erases a 10-point fourth-quarter deficit to beat the Packers in overtime and jump into first place in the NFC North . the game was one of the best games of the season as the Bears overcame another late deficit to pull out an OT win over the Packers .

title: Railways revises passenger fares again; AC and express travel gets 'little' costlier
content: a passenger travelling 500 km in a non-AC coach will have to pay Rs 10 extra . this is the second fare revision by Indian Railways during the current financial year . ordinary class passengers travelling up to 215 km will not face any fare hike, railway ministry sources said .

title: Inside the Bears' wild comeback win over the Packers in OT
content: the Bears had a 16-9 lead and a 96.9% chance of winning the key NFC North battle . at that point, the Packers' win percentage had dipped to 86.9% . there was no reason to believe in a miracle comeback, except that the bears have lived dangerously all season .

title: 4th elephant death on rail tracks this year, toll rises to 94 since 2019
content: the last two accidents were reported from Jalpaiguri in west Bengal . this was the fourth such accident this year . the safety of elephants remains a concern on rail corridors passing through forest areas . 81 elephants have been killed after being hit by trains between 2019-20 and 2023-24 .

content: the defending champions clinch the NFC East crown for the 2nd straight season . the Eagles took a moment to soak in the accomplishment postgame, posing for pictures and dapping up one another . coach Nick Sirianni has led Philadelphia to the postseason in each of his five seasons .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
